result.execSummary:
The defendant Roxanna Therese Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roxanna Therese Ramirez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roxanna Therese Ramirez was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roxanna Therese Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Agreement / Letter of Understanding

9:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles, a resolution has been reached.  Atty Peebles recites plea agreement - 14CF72: charge will be be amended to a misdemeanor; 14CF27 - count 1 will be dismissed, defendant will plea to count 2 with a fine and costs.  2014TR864 will be dismissed.  DA concurs.  Statement by DA.  Atty Peebles concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court dismisses 2014TR864 and adds the Ignition Interlock Device for a period of 12 months to 2014TR658.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended count 1 on 2014CF72 and count 2 on 2014CF127.  Court orders count 1 on 2014CF127 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Peebles.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF127

Court sentences the defendant to a $250 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.


2014CF72

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months probation.  Court grants huber.

CONDITIONS:
-court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on January 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

3:33 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney James Peebles.  

Statement by Attorney Peebles - requests preliminary hearing be scheduled on 2014CF127.  Court so directs and to be held after the first of the year.  Court directs 2014CF72 to track with that case.

Court adjourned at 3:35 p.m.
Status hearing on December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:06 a.m.    Defendant present in court with Atty. Jim Pebbles via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Pebbles confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Atty Pebbles waives the time limits.  Court will set for status in 30 days.  Statement by Atty Pebbles - requests this matter track with 2014CF72 which is set for status on December 8, 2014, at 3:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:08 a.m.
